meanings.definition: To assign an actor a role that corresponds to a stereotype.
meanings.sent1: In the play, they typecast the actor as the villain because of his deep voice.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to be typecast as the funny sidekick in every movie.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the director typecast the dog as the lead detective in the film.
meanings.sent4: The teacher typecast the students into different groups based on their favorite subjects.
meanings.sent5: The company tends to typecast employees based on their previous job roles.

meanings.definition: To categorize someone or something according to a particular characteristic or stereotype.
meanings.sent1: The magazine typecast the new artist as a pop sensation before even hearing her music.
meanings.sent2: It's unfair to typecast people based on their appearance without getting to know them.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly typecast the fruit as a vegetable and put it in the wrong bin.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was being typecast into the role of the 'reliable friend' in her social group.
meanings.sent5: The author didn't want to be typecast into writing only one genre of books.
